Dialogue.NPCText:
Before you kneels a young man in tribal garb, tracing swirling symbols into the dirt with absent-minded focus. His eyes dart with nervous energy, yet there is an earnest hope in his face.

He glances up, and for a moment you sense the weight of visions half-understood.

“Um… are you here to help? The spirits… they've been whispering, but their meaning… slips away like mist.”

Option.text: Are you Kelnu Brightribs, the vision-seeker?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kelnu looks at his hand, startled, then at the marks. “These… I don’t even remember starting them! They’re everywhere now. Shaman Nura says they might be omens—warnings from the roots, the wind, the old bones.

Can you see any pattern? Sometimes, if you look closely, the meaning changes… or do I just wish it did?”

Option.text: They remind me of ancient runes.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Yes! I’m Kelnu. My mother was Brightribs, my father… well, he walked the spirit path before I could remember his face. I’m meant to watch for visions, and prove myself. But these dreams… I fear what they show.”

Option.text: What do you hope to prove?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kelnu’s fingers twitch. “It’s the dreams, and the way I wake with my hands muddy, always scribbling. Nura says some things want to be spoken—others, only written and hidden.
Sometimes, I think something ancient is calling… or warning us about Minax. I’m not brave enough to look alone.”

Option.text: Let me help you interpret the signs.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kelnu’s eyes widen. “A map? Spirits, yes… see the lines? They bend toward the Old Willow Hollow. I dreamed of roots, of a buried thing… glowing and wrong.
If you follow the marks at night, you might find what I saw. Will you go?”

Option.text: Yes, I’ll follow the map tonight.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kelnu leans close, excited. “Runes! Old as the bones of the hills. Some shapes repeat—like the double spiral for binding, or the eye for seeing danger. My hands make them, but my mind… it’s all fragments.
Maybe if you gather other runes in the wilds, the spirits will show us more?”

Option.text: How do I find these runes?

Dialogue.NPCText: “You might be right. My dreams are full of shadows crawling from the trees, and a woman’s voice, cold as stone. She wants the relic buried under the willow. If you find it before she does, maybe our tribe will be safe.”

Option.text: I’ll keep watch, but stay cautious.

Dialogue.NPCText: Kelnu forces a weak smile. “Maybe… But the elders say the last time these marks appeared, the woods burned. Still, I suppose every storm passes, right?”

Option.text: Storms pass, and so do troubles. Take care.
I want to help you, if I can.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kelnu stares into the middle distance, voice dropping. “Fire in the roots. Bones in a circle. A woman’s laughter echoing through black vines. Each time I close my eyes, it grows sharper.
Nura says these are warnings—of a relic tainted by Minax, waiting under the willow. If you can find it, maybe the visions will stop… for both of us.”

Option.text: How can I find this relic?

Dialogue.NPCText: “I want to show the elders I can read the signs—not just see them. If I help save the tribe, maybe I’ll become more than just… the awkward dreamer. Maybe I’ll be worthy of a spirit name.”

Option.text: Let me help you prove yourself.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Seek hollow trees, mossy stones—places where the spirit-wind lingers. Use this chalk, and you’ll be able to see runes that others can’t. Bring me what you find, and maybe the pattern will reveal itself.”

Option.text: Thank you. I’ll begin my search.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“The Old Willow Hollow is east of camp. At night, strange lights float around its roots. Dig there, and you may find a hidden cache.
If you bring me whatever is hidden there, I will share what the spirits show next.”

Option.text: I’ll find the cache beneath the willow.

Dialogue.NPCText: Kelnu presses a palm to yours, passing a bark-wrapped scroll marked in swirling green. “Let the spirits guide you, friend. And… if you hear her voice in the trees, don’t answer. Just keep moving.”

Option.text: I’ll return when I have the relic.
Option.action: SendMessage:Find the cache beneath the Willow Hollow and return to Kelnu.

Dialogue.NPCText: Kelnu’s gaze is haunted. “If you see shadows in the shape of antlers, run. That’s no spirit I’d trust.”

Option.text: Thank you, Kelnu. I’ll be careful.

Dialogue.NPCText: “I see Nura often. She’s patient, but says the spirits have chosen me for a reason. Still, I wish they’d speak plainly, just once…”

Option.text: Maybe together, we can find meaning.

Dialogue.NPCText: Kelnu nods, his fingers drifting to the next pattern. “May the woods shelter you, and your dreams bring only good.”

Kelnu blinks, surprised. “No one really asks about me. I guess… I’m still figuring that out myself.”

He scratches another glyph into the earth. “I wasn’t born a seer. That started after… after the lightning took my mother.”

Option.text: Did your visions start after that?
Do you believe the spirits chose you?
Have you always lived with the Verdant Tribes?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kelnu's voice lowers. “There was a storm — a spirit storm. The kind that makes the trees whisper and the flames dance backwards.”

“She ran out to gather the tribe’s sacred bark scrolls from the grove… and didn’t return.” He pauses. “They found her the next morning. Her eyes were wide open, glowing faint green. I think… she saw something.”

Option.text: I’m sorry. That must have been hard.
What do you think she saw?

Dialogue.NPCText: Kelnu nods slowly. “Thanks. Most just say it was ‘her time’ or ‘the spirits needed her.’ But it didn’t feel right. I still dream of her… standing by the old grove, trying to speak, but no sound comes out.”

“I think she saw the same thing I see now — the roots glowing from within, and Minax’s shadow in the branches.”

Kelnu grips his arms. “Whatever it was… it stayed with me.”

“Sometimes… when I focus near the sacred trees, I hear humming — like her lullabies. Maybe she walks with the spirits now.”
He smiles faintly. “I don’t want to waste the gift she may have passed on.”

Option.text: You’re stronger than you think, Kelnu.
The tribe needs seers like you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Yes. The day after her death, I woke up with my hands full of charcoal and bark scraps… symbols I’d never seen before, drawn while I slept.”

“I still don’t know if I was chosen or cursed. Maybe both.”

Option.text: What do the symbols mean to you?
Do you ever control what you draw?

Dialogue.NPCText: Kelnu closes his eyes. “They’re like music I can’t hear, but I feel the rhythm. I think they’re warnings. I just don’t speak the language yet.”

Option.text: Maybe together we can translate them.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Only once — when I tried to draw with my off-hand, the symbols came out clean and curved. Like they weren’t mine.”

“Nura says that may mean a spirit uses me like a conduit. I hope it’s one of the gentle ones.”

“I want to believe they chose me. That there’s purpose. But part of me wonders… what if I was just close when something cracked through the veil?”

He frowns. “Does intent matter, if the result is the same?”

Option.text: It matters. You chose to honor the gift.
Spirits or not, you’re doing good.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I was born here, under the canopy of the Verdant groves. I learned to track deer before I could write.”

“I love the silence between birdcalls, the way the wind speaks if you listen. Cities are loud and… wrong.”

Option.text: You’re truly a child of the forest.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Sometimes. But every time I dream of leaving, something follows me. A shadow with antlers. It waits at the edge of my path. I think… I belong here. For now.”

Option.text: Stay. The forest needs guardians like you.
